@Steve Williams you clearly are frustrated that something isn't working. That is however no excuse for the way you're engaging here. Chris and others have pointed out to you in the past how your way of engaging is outside acceptable norms in Bytecode Alliance spaces. I myself have reached out to you about related things in the past as well.

You're being confrontational and refusing to take in requests and suggestions meant to make your engagement more productive for all involved.

To be as clear as possible, and with my Technical Steering Committee member hat on: you have to stop these behaviors. You can NOT tell someone they're "getting annoying" and "stay out of my threads" as a reply to a polite request to change behaviors that are disruptive to others in this space. And whether you see them as such or not, your ways of engaging are disruptive: there is no such thing as "your threads, and messages in streams that people have subscribed to will notify them.

@Steve Williams I looked through the history of conversations involving both you and Chris, and disagree with your claim. But even if it were true, that wouldn't give you the right to be rude.

Additionally, your way of engaging not just with Chris but also others in this thread is not okay either. You don't like Zulip; that's okay. We'll not switch to something else as a result, though. If you want to engage in our spaces, you have to do it within the bounds we set, even if they're not the ones you want.
